place.name: ASHLEY
place.gazetteerText: ASHLEY-CUM-SILVERLEY, a parish in Newmarket district, Cambridge; on the verge of the county, at Ashley Gap, 4 miles ESE of Newmarket r. station. It has a post office, of the name of Ashley, under New market. Acres, 2,143. Real property, £3,293. Pop., 509. Houses, 109. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory and a vicarage-Ashley rectory, Silverley vicarage in the diocese of Ely. Value, £150.* Patron, the Hon. W. R. J. North. The church was built in 1845. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
